author: Mirage News
title: 'Another Body' documentary exposes harm of deepfake tech | Mirage News
text: Deepfake technology - the use of deep-learning artificial intelligence to create fake content online - creates a troubling portrait of consent in the digital age. A 2019 report by Sensity, a company that detects and monitors sexual deepfakes, found that 95% of all online deepfake videos are nonconsensual porn and 90% of those featured women. The Milstein Program in the College of Arts and Sciences, partnering with Cornell Cinema, will present [a free screening of the documentary "Another Body,"](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cs3Wlf9BcEI) which focuses on the gendered implications of deepfake technology. The screening will be on Wednesday, February 7, at 7 p.m. at Cornell Cinema. This event is part of the [Science on Screens](https://scienceonscreen.org/) initiative, and will feature an introduction by Gili Vidan, assistant professor of information science in the Cornell Ann S. Bowers College of Computing and Information Science, as well as a post-show Q&A with one of the film's directors. "Another Body" follows a college student's search for answers and justice after she discovers that the image of her face has been used without her consent in deepfake pornography. "As deepfakes become increasingly commonplace, the film provides a look at the culture of the people behind them and asks why they do it. The answer is disturbing," says Milstein Program director [Austin Bunn](https://pma.cornell.edu/austin-bunn), associate professor of performing & media arts. [Read the full story on the College of Arts and Sciences website.](https://as.cornell.edu/news/another-body-documentary-exposes-harm-deepfake-technology) [here](/another-body-documentary-exposes-harm-of-1161856/).

organizations.name: cornell ann s. bowers college of computing and information science

author: @nbc6
title: Vermont GOP rules bar it from promoting any candidate who is a ‘convicted felon'
text:
The Vermont Republican Party is prohibited from backing a candidate with a felony conviction, according to the party’s publicly posted rules .
That is now a bit of a problem, since the presumptive Republican presidential nominee was recently convicted on 34 felony counts .
“The state committee will not support or promote any candidate for elective office who … is a convicted felon,” read the rules, which govern everything from party meetings to how delegates must vote at national conventions.
On social media, the party does technically appear to be following the rule — there are no mentions of Donald Trump on the Vermont GOP’s Twitter or Facebook pages in the days since the former president’s historic guilty verdict in his hush money case — but the party’s social media typically talks only about local candidates and presidential candidates who visit the state.
The rule has been on the books since at least 2013, according to an archived version of the rules, but by early 2022, the party appears to have amended their rules.
Donald Trump Jun 5 Trump's gun license expected to be revoked after conviction in hush money trial Donald Trump Jun 5 Trump Georgia election case halted pending outcome of challenge to D.A. According to the Internet Archive, the posted rules were changed by March 2022 to allow the state committee to exempt a candidate from the rule by majority vote.
It’s unclear if such a rule will affect how Vermont’s GOP delegates vote at the Republican National Convention in July.
Former U.N Ambassador Nikki Haley won all of Vermont’s delegates but suspended her campaign in March; she has since endorsed Trump. The party rules dictate that delegates to the RNC are not bound if a candidate withdraws or suspends their campaign.
The Republican National Committee and Paul Dame, chair of the Vermont Republican Party, did not immediately respond to requests for comment.
In 2022, when Trump announced his bid for the presidency, Dame said in a statement that he did not believe Trump was the right choice for the party.
“I believe that the best thing for the future of the party is for other qualified and accomplished Republicans to join the primary to give Republican voters a better choice in the 2024 election,” he said.
In a statement, the Democratic National Committee suggested Vermont Republicans instead support President Joe Biden in November.
“We already knew Donald Trump was a threat to the American people and our democracy, but according to the Vermont GOP’s own rules, Donald Trump isn’t even eligible to receive their support,” Deputy Communications Director Abhi Rahman said. “We look forward to the Vermont Republican Party supporting Joe Biden this November — the only candidate with a path to 270 that has not been convicted of a felony.”
This story first appeared on NBCNews.com . More from NBC News:
Progressive groups rescind endorsements of former Rep. Mondaire Jones Defense Secretary Austin says protecting civilians in Gaza is a ‘strategic imperative’ Judge orders Steve Bannon to report to prison on July 1 for contempt of Congress sentence

author: @Brasil_de_Fato
title: Associação de Moradores arranca da prefeitura de Hortolândia (SP) 35 dias para evitar despejo de sede histórica
text: A prefeitura de [Hortolândia](https://www.brasildefato.com.br/2019/04/17/reintegracao-em-hortolandia-sp-e-mantida-e-150-familias-podem-ficar-desalojadas/) (SP), sob a gestão de Zezé Gomes (Republicanos), amanheceu com sua entrada travada por um corredor humano de manifestantes, nesta quinta-feira (8). Com o ato, membros da associação de moradores dos bairros Parque Santo André, Jd. Santa Amélia e Jd. Everest conseguiram mais 35 dias para evitar a remoção forçada da sede onde estão há 40 anos. A reintegração de posse - inicialmente marcada para a próxima segunda-feira (12) e agora suspensa temporariamente - faz parte da intenção da administração de Gomes de instalar, no lugar, uma creche a ser gerida por uma Organização de Sociedade Civil (OSC). Instalada no espaço antes da criação do próprio município de Hortolândia, que tem 33 anos, a Sociedade dos Amigos destes três bairros (Samest) tinha a concessão pública do uso do imóvel até 2050. No último 12 de julho, a direção da associação foi surpreendida com a notificação de que a concessão tinha sido revogada e que em um mês seriam despejados caso não saíssem do imóvel por conta própria. "Esta concessão foi revogada do dia para a noite pelo prefeito Zezé Gomes sem nenhum diálogo com os moradores, a associação, a Câmara dos Vereadores. Foi um 'decretasso'. Simplesmente achou que, na canetada, pode acabar com a Samest", afirma Lucas Bueno, membro do coletivo de educação popular Flor de Maio, um dos que compõem a gestão da associação. Entre as atividades realizadas pela entidade comunitária estão um cursinho pré-vestibular, formação para educadores, aulas de libras, ballet e capoeira, encontro de narcóticos anônimos, biblioteca, horta comunitárias, cine-debates e um grupo de astronomia popular. "Conseguimos a suspensão da revogação do termo de concessão do uso do espaço público que a gente tinha em mãos", explica Carolina Catini, coordenadora do programa de extensão do coletivo Flor de Maio. "Suspenderam por 35 dias, colocando a possibilidade de a gente encontrar um lugar para a creche que querem implementar, que não é demanda do bairro", conta. A poucos quarteirões da sede, há uma creche municipal que leva, inclusive, o nome de um dos ex-diretores da Samest. "Por que precisam que seja especificamente o prédio da associação, que não é adaptado para crianças, aquele destinado à creche?", questiona um documento da entidade. "Por que, em vez disso, não alugar outro espaço para alocar a creche? Qual a necessidade de tirar de sua sede uma das poucas associações de moradores que continuam promovendo tantas atividades para a comunidade?", segue o manifesto. Ao Brasil de Fato, a gestão municipal de Hortolândia informou que estabeleceu o prazo de cinco dias úteis para a associação visitar um espaço localizado em outro bairro, o Jd. Santa Clara do Lago I. "A prefeitura propôs a Samest mudar-se para esse local", afirmou. Nova reunião entre a prefeitura e associação está agendada para daqui a 15 dias. Edição: Martina Medina [](https://apoie.brasildefato.com.br/?utm_source=site&utm_medium=bannersite&utm_campaign=apoiase)

author: Marco
title: Not known Facts About Car Review Videos
text:
In the digital age, car review videos have become a staple for enthusiasts and potential buyers alike, offering an immersive and informative experience that goes beyond traditional written reviews. These videos, hosted by automotive experts, enthusiasts, or professional reviewers, provide an in-depth analysis of vehicles, showcasing their features, performance, and overall driving experience. Let's explore why car review videos have become an integral part of the automotive landscape and their impact on consumers.
Immersive Experience
Car review videos offer an immersive experience, allowing viewers to visually explore every aspect of a vehicle. From exterior design to interior features, these videos provide a detailed walkthrough, giving potential buyers a comprehensive look at the car's aesthetics and functionalities.
Expert Analysis and Insights
Professional reviewers often share their expertise and insights, analyzing the vehicle's performance, handling, comfort, and technology. Their expertise helps viewers understand the nuanced aspects of a car's performance and capabilities, aiding in making informed purchasing decisions.
Real-world Tests and Demonstrations
Many car review videos include real-world tests and demonstrations, showcasing the vehicle's capabilities in various conditions. From acceleration tests to off-road capabilities, these demonstrations give viewers a practical understanding of how the car performs in different scenarios.
Consumer Empowerment
Car review videos empower consumers by providing transparent and unbiased evaluations. Viewers gain access to honest opinions and firsthand experiences, enabling them to form their own assessments of a vehicle's pros and cons.
Entertainment and Engagement
Beyond informative content, car review videos often include entertaining elements such as charismatic hosts, engaging editing styles, and captivating visuals. These aspects enhance the viewing experience, keeping audiences engaged and entertained throughout the review.
Impact on the Automotive Industry
The popularity of car review videos has influenced the automotive industry significantly. Automakers now recognize the importance of digital media in shaping consumer opinions. They often collaborate with influencers or provide vehicles for review, leveraging the reach and influence of these videos to showcase
you can try here their products.
Evolution of Content Platforms
Car review videos are prevalent across various platforms, including YouTube, automotive websites, and social media channels. YouTube, in particular, hosts a vast array of content creators specializing in car reviews, attracting millions of viewers worldwide.
Conclusion
Car review videos have transformed the way consumers research and engage with automobiles. Their combination of expertise, entertainment, and detailed insights provides a comprehensive understanding of a vehicle's attributes. In an ever-evolving digital landscape, these videos continue to play a pivotal role in shaping consumer preferences, influencing buying decisions, and fostering a community of automotive enthusiasts eager for engaging and informative content.
